stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Energy Sector Spear Phish Emails Contain DarkComet RAT
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 21 October 2014, a U.S. energy sector organization reported it had received five emails sent to valid email addresses for four high level managers within the organization. The emails were sent from dianerowe@ns1.google.com with the subject line "URGENT QUOTATION", and a malicious 7z attachment containing a carrier/injector file for DarkComet RAT. The DarkComet RAT was observed in sandbox analysis attempting DNS resolution for the domain daviswc.zapto.org.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
---- BEGIN EMAIL HEADERS ---- EHLO <[REDACTED]> MAIL From:<dianerowe@ns1.google.com> SIZE=2538867 RCPT To:<[REDACTED]>. DATA. Received: from [REDACTED] by [REDACTED] with SMTP id s9L9bOo5016686 for <[REDACTED]>; Tue, 21 Oct 2014 04:42:31 -0500 Received: from ns1.google.com (v157-7-64-128.z1d9.static.cnode.jp [157.7.64.128]) by [REDACTED] with ESMTP id 1q3ahg07um-1 (version=TLSv1/SSLv3 cipher=AES256-SHA bits=256 verify=NOT) for <[REDACTED]>; Tue, 21 Oct 2014 04:42:25 -0500 Received: from dianerowe by ns1.google.com with local (Exim 4.82) (envelope-from <dianerowe@ns1.google.com>) id 1XgVxO-000055-3J. for [REDACTED] Tue, 21 Oct 2014 18:42:22 +0900 To: [REDACTED] Subject: URGENT QUOTATION From: [REDACTED POSSIBLE PII] <promax_pmxpcb@sa.com> Reply-To: MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=DD817C7A23D4F4325E3E0405B2E5AD8A Message-Id: <E1XgVxO-000055-3J@ns1.google.com> Date: Tue, 21 Oct 2014 18:42:22 +0900 X-AntiAbuse: This header was added to track abuse, please include it with any a buse report. X-AntiAbuse: Primary Hostname - ns1.google.com X-AntiAbuse: Original Domain - [REDACTED] X-AntiAbuse: Originator/Caller UID/GID - [501 512] / [47 12] X-AntiAbuse: Sender Address Domain - ns1.google.com X-Get-Message-Sender-Via: ns1.google.com: authenticated_id: dianerowe/only user confirmed/virtual account not confirmed ---- END EMAIL HEADERS ----
---- BEGIN EMAIL BODY ---- Content-Type: text/plain. Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit.
Please quote your best offer for the supply of the following items for our curr ent project as attached..
Where you can't comply please specify, all details enclosed. Looking forward fo r the soonest reply.
Thanks & Regards
[REDACTED POSSIBLE PII]
Product Design Engineer
images Promax Technology Integration Pte.Ltd. Blk 3013 Bedok Industrial Park E, #02-2088, Singapore 489979 Mail: bsingh@pmxpcb.com
---- END EMAIL BODY ----
There were 2 files within the 7z archive named BOQ Order.scr and PURCHASE- ORDER.scr. A sample of the SMTP for the attachment follows:
--DD817C7A23D4F4325E3E0405B2E5AD8A Content-Type: ; name="PURCHASE ORDER.7z" Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64 Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="PURCHASE ORDER.7z"

This file is created in %temp% during installation (MD5 fc5a85ef78c3e5cba6e1f756815a9398). The file then copies itself to %appdata%\Microsoft\atiesrx.exe and %appdata%a\Microsoft\IpOverUsbSvrc.exe.
The file BOQ%20ORDER.exe injects code into a suspended instance of the Visual Basic Compiler command line tool, file path "C:\WINDOWS\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v2.0.50727\vbc.exe". and then starts the process.
Cuckoo Sandbox identified strings for the DarkComet RAT including mutexes in memory in the process space for vbc.exe.
Antivirus_Result: WIN.Trojan.DarkKomet 1156-vbc.exe
The malware modifies a registry key with Setval to add persistence as in the following example:
\REGISTRY\USER\S-1-5-21-1409082233-688789844-725345543-1003\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\"Multimedia Class Scheduler" = C:\Documents and Settings\admin\Application Data\Microsoft\IpOverUsbSvrc.exe

The instance of DarkComet RAT running in memory attempts DNS resolution (from the process space C:\WINDOWS\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v2.0.50727\vbc.exe) of the domain name daviscwc.zapto.org
If successfully resolved, the RAT attempts to contact a C2 server by sending a 264 byte packet to destination port 1211.
